ModuleDescription: General description of basic ML concepts; covering fundamentals.
Explores supervised learning; including classification and regression.
Advanced supervised methods; e.g., SVMs and KNNs.
Covers clustering; dimensionality reduction; and Generative AI.
In-depth on k-means; PCA; t-SNE; and clustering evaluation.
Introduces perceptrons; activation functions; and multilayer NNs.
Details on NN learning; backprop; convolutions; and optimization.
Fundamental math concepts for AI; including vectors; matrices; and sets.
advanced vector calculus; differentiation; Jacobians; Hessians.
Concepts of entropy and KL divergence.
Discrete/continuous RVs; binomial distribution.
Expert level: Bayes' theorem and conditional probability.
Eigenvalues; eigenvectors; trace; and determinant.
ML advances in medicine; focusing on radiology and other areas.

ModuleName: ML Applications in medicine - UK Tübingen
ModuleDescription: ML applications at UK Tübingen; especially in radiology.
Ethical; legal; and privacy considerations in medical AI.
Design and implementation of chatbots for medical use cases.
ML applications in bioinformatics and drug discovery; e.g. 'Omics' data.
ML applications in medical imaging.
ML applications in radiation therapy.
